A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Well... it's better than Force Awakens.

First the good: 
Mark Hamill gave a great performance as Luke Skywalker\, the legend with feet of clay. They gave him good material to work with\, and he made the most of it.

Finally some respect for Leia - She's not given too much to do\, but this character got some much needed and deserved attention. 

The cinematography is outstanding. This is a visually beautiful film. The sets and locations just\,... pop. The action sequences flow well and are easy to follow without appearing overly choreographed. 

Adam Driver gets his Snape on\, making Darth Vader wanna-be\, Kylo Ren sympathetic and interesting\, a miracle in and of itself.

Humor/heart - parts of the film are genuinely funny...like\, intentionally. The script gave every character something to work with\, a chance to develop\, a reason for the audience to cheer for them

Now the stuff that could have been better (No spoilers)
There are several rather large plot holes\, some big enough to drive a star-destroyer through. Enough said\, for now.

The three new main characters are completely ineffectual. They\, literally\, accomplish nothing that they set out to do. They\, in fact\, fail rather spectacularly. This appears to be solely for the sake of developing character arcs. Though refreshing at first\, it's odd to have a film where the main characters contribute nothing to the resolution of the plot.

I wish directors would stop remaking their favorite scenes from the original trilogy. I had a strong sense of deja vu as I watched reshoots of the siege of the rebel base on Hoth\, the Falcon flying through the death star\, the attempt to deactivate the tractor beam\, etc. I'm begging you\, please\, give us something new. Do something original. Blow our minds.

Penguin dogs - You'll find out. These things are super cute and completely unnecessary. They exist solely to provide Disney with something to merchandise.

The Upshot:

This was good - not great - but definitely worth the price of admission. I
had low expectations after The Force Awakens\, and that certainly helped\, but there's stuff in here that deserves applause.
